security: Revealing that the CIA is collecting personality information on foreign officials could compromise intelligence gathering operations. Additionally, confirming Jose Fernandezâ€™s anti-communist stance and his value to Castro could affect Cuban internal dynamics. Quoting directly: 'It is requested that the addressees take no action on any of the individuals mentioned in the personality reports without first checking with this Agency.'
summary: This report details information on Jose Fernandez, a high-ranking Cuban military officer, noting his roles in army training, defense preparations, and his complex relationship with the Castro regime.
summary_one_paragraph: This August 1964 CIA report compiles personality information on Jose Fernandez, a key figure in the Cuban military. The report, sourced from a former Cuban Intelligence officer and supplemented by agency records, describes Fernandez as the chief of all army training schools and a significant military strategist, particularly in defense preparations. Despite attending artillery schools in the U.S. and being described as non-Communist, Fernandez maintains a crucial role under Fidel Castro due to his military expertise, even though Castro is likely aware of Fernandez's anti-Communist leanings. The CIA cautions against taking any action against Fernandez without consulting the Agency.
title: JOSE FERNANDEZ
recipient: STATE, DIA, ARMY, NAVY, AIR, NSA, OCR, FBI, REP, CINCLANT, CINCSO, I&NS
